conclusion: Identify the initial directions of the four streams (A, B, C, D) from the nozzles at the top.
Observe the orientations of the angled baffles. Each baffle either diverts a falling stream to the left or to the right until it meets the next baffle.
Follow each streamâ€™s path through this cascade of deflections until it reaches the row of collection channels at the bottom.
Determine whether, at the final deflection, the fluid is guided toward the channel that connects to container E (left-hand side) or toward the channel that connects to container F (right-hand side).
Streams from A and C ultimately reach container E.
Streams from B and D ultimately reach container F.
